com.larkwoodlabs.channels
Class ChannelPump<MessageType>

java.lang.Object
  com.larkwoodlabs.channels.ChannelPump<MessageType>
Type Parameters:
MessageType - The message object type.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public final class ChannelPump<MessageType>
extends Object
implements Runnable

A message pump uses an internal thread to continuously receive messages from an InputChannel and send those messages to an OutputChannel. The internal thread is started and stopped using the start() and stop(int) methods.

Author:
Greg Bumgardner (gbumgard)

ChannelPump

public ChannelPump(InputChannel<MessageType> inputChannel,
                   OutputChannel<MessageType> outputChannel)
Constructs a channel pump that connects the specified input and output channels. The start() method must be called to start the pump.

Method Detail

start

public final void start()
Starts the message pump.

stop

public final void stop(int milliseconds)
                throws InterruptedException
Attempts to stop the message pump within the specified amount of time.

Parameters:
milliseconds - The amount of time to wait for the pump to stop. Pass a value of zero to wait indefinitely.
Throws:
InterruptedException

close

public void close()
           throws InterruptedException,
                  IllegalStateException,
                  IOException
Convenience method that stops the channel pump and optionally closes the attached input and output channels.

Throws:
InterruptedException - The calling thread was interrupted while waiting for the pump to close.
